snippet: A growing number of Muslims are trying to find their path through the rough-and-tumble world of finance — an environment that can often test their values and practices.
abstract: Growing number of young Muslims are trying to find their path through the rough-and-tumble world of finance, an environment that can often test their values and practices; limitations of Islam often seem at odds with Wall Street's sometimes bacchanalian culture; for many Muslims in New York and elsewhere who have made peace with a more secular culture, working in finance may not pose any problem.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of Muslims are trying to find their path through the rough-and-tumble world of finance — an environment that can often test their values and practices.

headline.seo: Muslims on Wall Street, Bridging Two Traditions
headline.main: Muslims on Wall Street, Bridging Two Traditions
headline.print_headline: Muslims on Wall Street, Bridging Two Traditions
